bibl.title: Antony Hain v. King County. Letter from J.M. Hall
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: Territory of Washington 3rd Judicial District SS
In District Court holding terms at Seattle in King County In the Matter of the application of Anthony Han for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
div1.p: The said Anthony Han demurs to the Sheriffs return of the said Writ of Habeas Corpus and excepts to the sufficency thereof for the following reason, to writ:-

Because Samuel Greene Eager has no authority or jurisidiction to sentence said Hain to imprisionment on communication pettit larceny and no authority or jurisidiction to surface the sentence of imprisonment; and the said sentence and commitment thereafter, and all the proceedings thereunder are illegal and void.
div1.ab: Wherefore said Han prays to be discharged from custody.
J.M. Hall Atty for the said Anthony Han

Filed on Oct 8th 1878 James Jerry Clerk Hon. H. Amherr
J.M. Hall for Han
